contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Three ships in the United States Navy have been named '''USS ''Saco''''' for the [[Saco River]] and for the [[Saco, Maine]]. * The first [[USS Saco (1863)|''Saco'']] was a gunboat launched in 1863, served in the Civil War and sold in 1883. * The second [[USS Saco (YT-31)|''Saco'' (YT-31)]] was a steam tug, built in 1912. She was acquired by the Navy in 1918 and served as a yard tug until 1927. * The third [[USS Saco (YTB-796)|''Saco'' (YTB-796)]] was a yard tug launched into service in 1968 and struck from the Naval Vessel Register in 2005, after serving in Guam. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Saco}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
